xwikidoc.title: Scalability & Performances
xwikidoc.content:
XWiki is written in Java/Java EE. As such it scales as well as Java scales.
= Virtual wikis =
XWiki Enterprise supports multi-tenancy, i.e. the ability to run hundreds and thousands of wikis on the same JVM (same webapp).
Some examples: * [[MyXWiki>>http://myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome]] currently hosts over 160 wikis on a single JVM * [[XWiki SAS Cloud>>http://network.xwiki.com]] currently hosts over 900 wikis.
See the tutorial on [[how to set up a Virtual XWiki environment>>AdminGuide.Virtualization]] to learn more.
= Clustering =
XWiki provides an easy way to setup clustered instances of XWiki based on network events distribution. Clustering allows for 2 use cases: * Load distribution on several JVMs * Failover since if a machine is down the other ones are still available
See [[AdminGuide.Clustering]] for more details.
